com.github.i49.hibiscus.schema

Class SchemaComponents

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.i49.hibiscus.schema.SchemaComponents

  • public final class SchemaComponents
extends Object
    The central class to create various kinds of schema components which are used to build your own schema to validate JSON documents.

    These schema components can be grouped as follows.

    • schema, which is represented by Schema.
    • build-in types, which are represented by JsonType and its subinterfaces.
    • object properties, which are represented by Property.

    Schema

    The Schema object is the top level component which contains other schema components for any schema to be built.

    The following code shows how to create a new schema.

    
 import static com.github.i49.hibiscus.schema.SchemaComponents.*;
 Schema t = schema(type1, type2, ...);

    schema() method above receives JsonTypes expected at the root of JSON documents.

    Built-in Types

    As the sample code shown above illustrates, a schema consists of several JsonTypes that can be nested inside other types and form a tree-like structure as a whole. The validation will match the values in JSON document against types declared in schema from the root to the terminal values.

    This library provides seven built-in types which can be used to compose schema for JSON.

    The list of built-in types
    No. Type Name Creation Method Interface Description Sample Values
    1 array array() ArrayType JSON array ["milk", "bread", "eggs"]
    2 bool bool() BooleanType JSON boolean true
    3 integer integer() IntegerType JSON number without a fractional part 42
    4 number number() NumberType JSON number 3.14
    5 null nil() NullType JSON null null
    6 object object() ObjectType JSON object {"name": "John", "age": 33}
    7 string string() StringType JSON string "hello"

    The following code shows how to create each of built-in types except array and object.

    
 BooleanType b = bool();
 IntegerType i = integer();
 NumberType n = number();
 NullType nil = nil();
 StringType s = string();

    The code listed below shows how to create an array type which elements must be string type.

    ArrayType a = array(string());

    The code listed below shows how to create an object type which has two properties.

    ObjectType a = object(p1, p2);

    The next section introduces how to create properties for object types.

    Object Properties

    JSON object can contain name-value pairs which are called properties. There are three kinds of properties to be created as listed below.

    1. required property
    2. optional property
    3. pattern property

    Both of the first two types of property have determined names. They can be distinguished by whether they are mandatory or not for the containing object.

    The code listed below shows how to create these types of property respectively.

    
 Property p1 = required("name", string());
 Property p2 = optional("age", integer());

    The last type of property does not have a determined name. The name of this property has some range and is specified as a regular expression.

    The code listed below shows how to create a pattern property.

    
 Property p3 = pattern("1st|2nd|3rd|[4-8]th", string());

    • Method Detail

      • schema

        public static Schema schema()
        Creates an empty schema.
        Returns:
        created schema.

      • schema

        public static Schema schema(JsonType... types)
        Creates a schema which expects specified JsonTypes at the root of JSON documents.
        Parameters:
        types - the JsonTypes allowed to be at the root of JSON documents. Each type must have a unique TypeId.
        Returns:
        created schema.
        Throws:
        SchemaException - if one of types given has the same TypeId as others or null.

      • array

        public static ArrayType array()
        Creates an array type with its elements unspecified.
        Returns:
        created array type.

      • array

        public static ArrayType array(JsonType... types)
        Creates an array type which expects specified JsonTypes as types of its elements.

        Calling this methods is equivalent to array().items(...).

        Parameters:
        types - the JsonTypes allowed for elements of this array. Each type must have a unique TypeId and cannot be null.
        Returns:
        created array type.
        Throws:
        SchemaException - if one of types given has the same TypeId as others or null.

      • bool

        public static BooleanType bool()
        Creates a boolean type.
        Returns:
        created boolean type.

      • integer

        public static IntegerType integer()
        Creates an integer type.
        Returns:
        created integer type.

      • number

        public static NumberType number()
        Creates a number type.
        Returns:
        created number type.

      • nil

        public static NullType nil()
        Creates a null type. Note that NullType is immutable and cannot be modified.
        Returns:
        created null type.

      • object

        public static ObjectType object()
        Creates an object type with its properties unspecified.
        Returns:
        an object type.

      • object

        public static ObjectType object(Property... properties)
        Creates an object type which expects specified properties as its members.

        Calling this methods is equivalent to object().properties(...).

        Parameters:
        properties - the properties which created object may contain. Each property cannot be null.
        Returns:
        created object type.
        Throws:
        SchemaException - if one of properties specified is null.

      • string

        public static StringType string()
        Creates a string type.
        Returns:
        created string type.

      • optional

        public static Property optional(String name,
                                JsonType type,
                                JsonType... moreTypes)
        Creates an object property which is optional for the containing object.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the property. Cannot be null.
        type - the type of the property value. Cannot be null.
        moreTypes - the other types allowed for the property value. Each type cannot be null.
        Returns:
        created object property.
        Throws:
        SchemaException - if name is null or if one of types has the same TypeId as others or null.

      • required

        public static Property required(String name,
                                JsonType type,
                                JsonType... moreTypes)
        Creates an object property which is required for the containing object.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the property. Cannot be null.
        type - the type of the property value. Cannot be null.
        moreTypes - the other types allowed for the property value. Each type cannot be null.
        Returns:
        created object property.
        Throws:
        SchemaException - if name is null or if one of types has the same TypeId as others or null.

      • pattern

        public static Property pattern(String pattern,
                               JsonType type,
                               JsonType... moreTypes)
        Creates an object property which name matches the pattern specified as a Java regular expression. Important note is that the pattern specified for this method must be compatible with Java regular expression, not with JavaScript alternative defined in the ECMA 262 specification.
        Parameters:
        pattern - the pattern of the name specified as a Java regular expression. Cannot be null.
        type - the type of the property value. Cannot be null.
        moreTypes - the other types allowed for the property value. Each type cannot be null.
        Returns:
        created object property.
        Throws:
        SchemaException - if pattern is null or if one of types has the same TypeId as others or null.
        PatternSyntaxException - if pattern's syntax is invalid.
        See Also:
        Pattern
